title: Here's a reading list of 20 articles up to 2020 that cover various aspects of commonsense reasoning, including different types of commonsense knowledge, methods for capturing commonsense, and ways to measure the commonsense reasoning abilities of models
**"Commonsense Knowledge and Commonsense Reasoning: An Overview"**
Overview of commonsense knowledge and reasoning, including key challenges and approaches
**"ConceptNet 5: A Large Semantic Network for Relational Knowledge"** - Robyn Speer
Discusses ConceptNet, a large-scale semantic network designed to capture commonsense knowledge
**"Learning Commonsense Knowledge from Text"**
publisher: Peter Clark, Phil Harrison, Niranjan Balasubramanian

title: Methods for extracting commonsense knowledge from textual data
**"Commonsense Knowledge Acquisition from the Web"**
Techniques for acquiring commonsense knowledge from web sources
**"The Winograd Schema Challenge"**
Introduction to the Winograd Schema Challenge, a benchmark for evaluating commonsense reasoning in AI
**"Commonsense Reasoning and Commonsense Knowledge in Artificial Intelligence"**
Comprehensive review of commonsense reasoning and knowledge in AI
**"Commonsense Knowledge Representation and Reasoning in the Cyc Project"**
Overview of the Cyc project, an ambitious effort to encode commonsense knowledge
**"Event2Mind: Commonsense Inference on Events, Intents, and Reactions"**
Discusses Event2Mind, a model for inferring commonsense knowledge about events, intents, and reactions
Commonsense Transformers for Automatic Knowledge Graph Construction"** - Antoine Bosselut
note: Hannah Rashkin, Maarten Sap, Chaitanya Malaviya, Asli Celikyilmaz, Yejin Choi, 2019.

title: Introduces COMET, a transformer-based model for generating commonsense knowledge
**"ATOMIC: An Atlas of Machine Commonsense for If-Then Reasoning"**
Presents ATOMIC, a large-scale knowledge graph for commonsense reasoning
**"SWAG: A Large-Scale Adversarial Dataset for Grounded Commonsense Inference"**
Introduces SWAG, a dataset for evaluating grounded commonsense inference
**"CommonsenseQA: A Question Answering Challenge Targeting Commonsense Knowledge"** - Alon Talmor
publisher: Jonathan Herzig, Nicholas Lourie, Jonathan Berant

title: Discusses CommonsenseQA, a benchmark for evaluating commonsense knowledge in QA systems
**"Story Cloze Test: A New Benchmark for Story Understanding and Generation"** - Nasrin Mostafazadeh
publisher: Nathanael Chambers, Xiaodong He, Devi Parikh, Dhruv Batra, Lucy Vanderwende, Pushmeet Kohli, James Allen

title: Introduces the Story Cloze Test, a benchmark for evaluating story understanding and generation
The Process Paragraph Dataset for Prototypical Event Sequence Generation"** - Ashwin Kalyan
Presents ProPara, a dataset for evaluating models on understanding and generating event sequences
**"RocStories: A Large-Scale Dataset for Understanding Commonsense Stories"** - Nasrin Mostafazadeh
publisher: Nathanael Chambers, Xiaodong He, Devi Parikh, Dhruv Batra, Lucy Vanderwende, Pushmeet Kohli, James Allen

title: Discusses RocStories, a dataset for evaluating commonsense story understanding

author.literal: **"Visual Commonsense R-CNN"** - Rowan Zellers, Mark Yatskar

title: Introduces Visual Commonsense R-CNN, a model for visual commonsense reasoning
**"Social IQa: Commonsense Reasoning about Social Interactions"**
Presents Social IQa, a dataset for evaluating commonsense reasoning about social interactions
**"Learning to Reason: End-to-End Module Networks for Visual Question Answering"** - Ronghang Hu
note: Jacob Andreas, Trevor Darrell, Kate Saenko, 2017.

title: Discusses end-to-end module networks for visual question answering with commonsense reasoning
**"Zero-Shot Commonsense Question Answering with Knowledge Graphs"** - Antoine Bosselut
note: Hannah Rashkin, Maarten Sap, Chaitanya Malaviya, Asli Celikyilmaz, Yejin Choi, 2019.

title: Explores zero-shot commonsense question answering using knowledge graphs
**"A Survey on Commonsense Knowledge Acquisition"** - Roberto Navigli
Comprehensive survey on methods for acquiring commonsense knowledge

These articles collectively provide a broad overview of the field of commonsense reasoning, covering various types of commonsense knowledge, methods for capturing it, and benchmarks for evaluating models' reasoning abilities
